page.title: 11THE NEWCOMER TO THE VILLAGE
page.content: {The Newcomer to the Village} I moved to Overton in August 1984 from Birmingham. This pattern of movement is unusual since house prices are 30% higher here. We moved because of my husband's job which is teaching. In theory employment is plentiful here but I have had some difficulty finding a teaching post for myself. We selected Overton because it possessed a Primary School, was close to a large centre (Basingstoke) but did have some shops of its own and was reputed to be friendly with plenty happening. Best described as a working class village, it is dominated by Portal's Mill. We have not found it to be as friendly as reputed and we have found a greater awareness of social class differences here than in our previous community.
